title: 2 Easy Ways to Remove User Accounts in Windows 10

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . Click the Start menu, and then click the cog icon.

steps.title: Click Accounts.
steps.content: Click Accounts . This icon looks like a silhouette of a person and says "Your accounts, email, sync, work, family."

steps.title: Click Family & other users.
steps.content: Click Family & other users . You'll see this in the vertical menu on the left side of the window. If you're using a work or school PC, you may have to select Other users or Other people instead. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. steps.title: Click the person you want to delete.
steps.content: Click the person you want to delete. You'll see more options appear for that user. If you see "Local account" below the user name, this account only exists on the current PC. If you don't see Local account , it's a Microsoft account. This means that this user can still access other Microsoft services like Outlook.com and Office on other devices.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . A confirmation message will appear, letting you know that all of that user's data will be removed from the PC if you continue.

steps.title: Click Delete account and data.
steps.content: Click Delete account and data . This removes all of the user's data from the PC.

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . Click the Start menu, and then click the cog icon. Use this method to change a standard user into an administrator . You must have a new administrator user before you can delete the previous one.

steps.title: Click Accounts.
steps.content: Click Accounts . This icon looks like a silhouette of a person and says "Your accounts, email, sync, work, family."

steps.title: Click Family & other users.
steps.content: Click Family & other users . You'll see this in the vertical menu on the left side of the window. If you're using a work or school PC, you may have to select Other users or Other people instead.

steps.title: Click the user you want to make administrator.
steps.content: Click the user you want to make administrator. You'll see more options appear for that user.

steps.title: Click Change account type.
steps.content: Click Change account type . This is next to Remove .

steps.title: Select Administrator.
steps.content: Select Administrator . Click the drop-down menu and set the new account type to Administrator .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will save your settings.

steps.title: Log into
steps.content: Log into the new administrator account. You'll need to provide the account's password. Once the new administrator account is set, you can use the above section to delete the old administrator account.
